body.p: The proto structure is a common Linux-system directory hierarchy whose root (/), therefore the remaining directories, is exactly an ordinary directory in a host filesystem. The next figure illustrates the general idea of a proto whose root directory is /home/lago/sandbox/debian-proto in other host filesystem, observe that the proto and the host have the same base directory hierarchy:
body.codeblock: bin/ boot/ dev/ etc/ home/ lago/ sandbox/ debian-proto/ bin/ boot/ dev/ etc/ home/ lib/ opt/ proc/ root/ sbin/ sys/ tmp/ usr/ var/ lib/ opt/ proc/ root/ sbin/ sys/ tmp/ usr/ var/
